task_summary: Grasp the visible drawer handle and actuate an opening motion until the drawer is open, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: The robot approaches a cabinet and opens a lower drawer by grasping its U-shaped handle and pulling the drawer outward. The contact-sheet shows progressive approach, grasp, and drawer displacement, culminating in a partially open drawer. The plan first ensures perception of the handle, orients the wrist, establishes a stable grasp, then uses a high-level open action for a drawer container. The sequence verifies the container state before retreating to clear the workspace, matching the observed frames.
preconditions: Drawer handle is visible or discoverable with scanning
Robot has clearance in front of the cabinet
Gripper is functional and can close on a bar handle
stepwise_plan: Navigate or move near cabinet area
Open gripper and align to the handle
Set wrist yaw for bar-like grasp
Close gripper to secure the handle
success_criteria: Drawer reported open by state check
Robot retreats to a safe standoff
failure_and_recovery: Handle not detected: retry detection up to three attempts
Misalignment: re-approach and realign then retry grasp
Grip slip during pull: reopen gripper, realign, and regrasp
Drawer jams: pause and retry open sequence with a small retreat and re-approach
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after container open is confirmed and the end-effector retreats to a safe standoff.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Move the base/arm to a cabinet approach pose for drawer interaction.
Perceive and localize the drawer handle before approaching.
Prepare the gripper with a wide opening for handle engagement.
Approach the handle and align the end-effector precisely.
Rotate tool yaw to match the bar handle orientation.
Close gripper to secure a stable hold on the handle.
Execute the drawer opening motion with controller support.
Verify that the drawer is now open.
Back off slightly to clear the open drawer front.
Short settle time to ensure motion completion.
Robust perception: retry handle detection up to three times.
Linear execution of the open-drawer task.

failure_modes: Handle not detected due to occlusion
Drawer friction or jam preventing opening
recovery_strategy: Retry detection with small view changes
Reopen and regrasp with adjusted yaw and force
Pause, retreat, and re-attempt open motion
assumptions: Frames show a bar-style drawer handle with outward pull to open
Container 'base_drawer' corresponds to the visible lower drawer
Yaw 90 deg aligns the gripper with handle axis despite slight uncertainty
High-level OpenContainer abstracts the pulling trajectory consistent with the frames

expected_success_criteria: No collision with fridge door or counter
